title: India bats for AI copyright regulation, as Big Tech raise key concerns
snippet: The government and Big Tech are at loggerheads over a proposed royalty framework for AI training data.

title: Humanoid Robots Pour Coffee, Fold Laundry at CES. Painfully Slowly
snippet: At the CES trade show in Las Vegas this week, robots poured coffee, played ping pong, dealt poker hands and folded laundry — all within a few feet of one another.

title: Google's AI overview says 2026 is next year. Elon Musk reacts
snippet: Elon Musk noted the flaws in Google's AI Overview, which mistakenly claimed 2026 is next year.&nbsp;

title: Apple’s next iPhone set to enter ‘mass production’, key details leaked
snippet: Apple's iPhone 17e is reported to enter ‘Production’ post-CES. The cheapest iPhone may come with a 6.1-inch display, A19 processor, and an upgraded 18MP front camera.&nbsp;

title: Meta's Ray-Ban Display won’t launch in more countries just yet. Here’s why
snippet: Meta has paused the international rollout of its Ray Ban Display glasses due to limited inventory and unprecedented demand. The glasses were set to debut in UK, France, Italy, and Canada later in the year but the company is focusing on fulfilling its orders in the US.&nbsp;

title: YouTube Music recommendations are filling up with AI-generated tracks leaving netizens fuming
snippet: The rise of AI-generated music recommendations on YouTube has angered many users of the platform. Users have taken to Reddit and other platforms to voice their concerns.

OpenAI launches ChatGPT Health to connect medical records, wellness apps
snippet: OpenAI has introduced a new health section in ChatGPT for medical and wellness questions. Users can upload records, link fitness apps and prepare for appointments, with added privacy safeguards. title: Anthropic said to be in talks to raise funding at a $350 billion valuation
snippet: Anthropic, maker of the Claude chatbot, is in talks to raise $10 billion, almost doubling its value to about $350 billion. However, the financing discussions are ongoing, and the plans could change. The deal reflects intense investor excitement around AI despite bubble fears.

title: OpenAI earmarks $50 billion for employee stock grant pool, The Information reports
snippet: OpenAI reportedly reserved a large share pool for staff in October, said to equal 10% of the firm valued at $500 billion, The Information reported. The company is also exploring new funding talks that might lift its valuation to about $750 billion soon, a 50% jump from OpenAI's reported $500 billion

title: Govt cracks down on Grok; India’s legal gap on deepfakes
snippet: Happy Thursday! The government has sought more details from X regarding obscene content generated on Grok. This and more in today’s ETtech Morning Dispatch.

title: Infosys' land sale among transactions Karnataka opens probe into for bypassing e-khata
snippet: The revenue authorities have made e-khata, or the digital version of a property’s official record, a compulsory document for the seller to produce for registering a property. The Kaveri 2.0 portal is designed to fetch the e-khata from the e-Swathu portal during registration.

title: X says it's introducing more Grok guardrails & refining safeguards
snippet: MeitY studying X response to notice on curbing obscene AI-generated content: Sources

title: AI skills headline SaaS hiring blitz with sustainability in sharper focus
snippet: SaaS hiring rose 14% in 2025, currently accounting for nearly a fifth of all technology jobs, showed data compiled by jobs platform foundit. Zoho, Freshworks, Keka, Zeta, Innovaccer, Whatfix, Darwinbox, and Wingify are among SaaS firms looking to add talent, recruiters told ET.

title: Haircare brand &Done raises $3 million funding led by RTP Global
snippet: Haircare brand &Done has raised $3 million in a funding round led by RTP Global, with participation from All-in Capital, Suashish, and angel investors Kitty Agarwal, partner at Info Edge Ventures, and Kunal Bahl and Rohit Bansal, cofounders of Titan Capital.

title: AI services startup Aivar raises $4.6 million led by Sorin, Bessemer
snippet: AI services startup Aivar has raised $4.6 million (about Rs 41 crore) in a seed funding round led by Sorin Investments, with participation from Bessemer Venture Partners. The funds will be used to expand the company’s presence across India, the US and the Middle East, and to invest in AI accelerator
